newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY'S NYBB RATES PICK AS "BUY".
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY'S NYBB RATES PICK AS "BUY".

text.p: Hungarian securities house New York Broker Budapest revised its short-term recommendation upwards to "buy" from "hold" it assigned in March for meat processor Pick Szeged Rt , on technical reasons.
At the same time New York Broker Budapest left Pick's long-term recommendation unchanged at "buy".

Analyst Gabriella Bor supported the "buy" ratings by fundamental and technical reasons, and said she expected Pick to benefit from rising domestic demand for the company's products and its expansion on the Russian market.
"Domestic demand is expected to rise as living standards improve and also as a result of (Pick's) active marketing activity and its new products," Bor said.
The analyst estimated Pick's earnings per share (EPS) rising to 1,126 forints by the end of 1997 from 903 at the end of 1996.
She saw Pick's consolidated after-tax profit rising to 2.99 billion forints on sales of 34.50 billion this year.
In 1996 Pick posted an after-tax profit of 2.43 billion on sales of 28.56 billion.
The analyst said the company could expect declining interest expenditures, "therefore its financial losses are approaching zero".
In the first quarter of 1997 Pick reduced its consolidated net financial loss to 0.6 million forints from 87.2 million forints in the same period of 1996.
Looking at technical factors, Bor said there was strong support level at 10,700 forints and "the price of the share was unlikely to fall below that."
She added that Pick's price was above the shorter-term moving averages which makes a rising trend probable.
